ACTOR2: MINURCA: United Nations Mission in the Central African Republic (1998-2000)
NOTES: Parliament reopened amid protests and was marked by the departure of all opposition members shortly after the session began. United Nations troops were sent to the building after the crowd demanded the departure of the republican guard.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Muslim Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Thousands of pro-Seleka Muslims protest against the French army in Bangui. This follows the death of three ex-Seleka members who died earlier that day during a clash with French soldiers. Congolese police force of MISCA intervented to moved protesters who were blocking a main road.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: A sit-in was staged at Bangui MPoko airport by youths. This prevented planes from landing. It was broken up by Chadian elements of MISCA who opened fire, killing four.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Elements of Anti-Balaka revolted against the killing of one of their members by FACA and demanding the disarmament of FACA. The situation was calmed through the intervention of MISCA and Sangaris some hours later.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Students (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: 300 students, dressed in black as a sign of mourning, organised a march to claim the right to education. The peaceful march was dispersed by the elements of Misca who fired shots and tear gas on them, to the dismay of demonstrators who wanted to submit a memorandum to the Head of State. Several students injured, including one who fell unconscious.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Muslim Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: More than 100 Muslims demonstrate outside the MINUSCA office against the death of a member of their community, who died in the incidents of 19th and 20th August. MISCA Force Commander, Brigadier General Martin chomu Tumenta, spoke with the demonstrators to calm the situation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Ex-Seleka protested once again against the plans to relocate them to other regions of the country. Some ex-Seleka were armed, but there we no reports of any incidents. The protest was contained by Sangaris, MINUSCA and EUFOR-RCA troops.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of France (2012-2017); MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Residents of Bambari marched to demand a return to normal for their city, and the departure of Seleka General Ali Darassa. Sangaris and MINUSCA forces were present to ensure the safety of those involved.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A march calling for freedom of mobility and goods and social cohesion was organized by the NGO Search for Common Ground. The marchers walked from Independence Avenue to Koudoukou Avenue. MINUSCA and gednarmerie forces kept watch over the march.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); Deutsche Welle; AFP; Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: A protest march was organized and a civil disobedience movement was called in response to the ongoing violence in Bangui. MINSUCA forces allegedly fired upon the several hundred marchers who were heading to the Office of the President to demand the resignation of the President with live bullets, killing 3 and injuring several, but UN sources dispute this. Most sources agree that three were killed.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: After a man was killed by alleged former Seleka fighters, residents of Kaga-Bandoro stormed the front of the MINUSCA office in the town and demanded the departure of the Pakistani contingent. The protesters were dispersed peacefully by the UN.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Residents of the Gbakondja Yassimandji neighbourhood of the 5th district of Bangui protested to demand the municipality provide electricity and deal with garbage collection which has become backed up in their area. MINUSCA and local police were on hand but no incidents were reported.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Following the death of a man at the Bangui M'Poko airport, displeased youths expressed their anger at the entrance to the airport guarded by international forces. According to the deputy, the international forces fired live bullet into the crowd, causing two deaths.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Women (Central African Republic); MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-); Aid Workers (Central African Republic)
NOTES: On 8 March 2021, about 200 women, including women serving with humanitarian organizations and MINUSCA, marched in Berberati (Berberati, Mambere-Kadei) on the occasion of the International Women's Day and protested for Women's Rights. [size=about 200]

ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: Residents again protested return of Banyamulenge refugees, fearing rebel infiltrators. MONUC attacked, 1 civilian killed.

ACTOR1: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
ACTOR2: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Civilians protesting MONUC because they want government to fight the rebels out of the territory theyre inhabiting.

ACTOR1: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
ACTOR2: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Civilians protesting MONUC because they want government to fight the rebels out of the territory theyre inhabiting.

NOTES: National staff of MONUSCO staged a 72-hour sit-in at MONUSCOs various headquarters across the DR-Congos provinces.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: National staff of MONUSCO began a second series of sit-ins in front of some UN mission sites in the DR-Congo, including Kinshasa, Kisangani, Bunia, Goma, and Bukavu.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: National staff of MONUSCO began a second series of sit-ins in front of some UN mission sites in the DR-Congo, including Kinshasa, Kisangani, Bunia, Goma, and Bukavu.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: National staff of MONUSCO began a second series of sit-ins in front of some UN mission sites in the DR-Congo, including Kinshasa, Kisangani, Bunia, Goma, and Bukavu.

NOTES: National staff of MONUSCO began a second series of sit-ins in front of some UN mission sites in the DR-Congo, including Kinshasa, Kisangani, Bunia, Goma, and Bukavu.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: National staff of MONUSCO began a second series of sit-ins in front of some UN mission sites in the DR-Congo, including Kinshasa, Kisangani, Bunia, Goma, and Bukavu.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 50 people, including the South African contingent of MONUSCO and members of the Volunteer Association of the Congo (ASVOCO), took part in a peace march in Goma ahead of Nelson Mandela Day.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On Monday 27th, Congolese citizens protested against the presence of Burundian refugees in Kamanyola. The protesters protested in front of the MONUSCO offices, where there are more than 2,800 Burundian refugees. Protesters were dispersed by MONUSCO forces. The report mentions that a cemetery where 39 refugees were buried had their crosses stolen by the protesters as an act of provocation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: On 21 January 2018, protests organised by the CLC in Kinshasa (Kinshasa , Kinshasa ) were choked by police, who used excessive force. Live bullets were shot near the St. Gabriel de Yolo Sud parish (commune of Kalamu), and one protester was injured. Protesters at Saint Jean-Baptiste parish were also dispersed with tear gas and live bullets; one protester was beaten up. MONUSCO reports that 6 protesters were killed, including a 16 year old girl, along with 57 people injured and more than 100 people arrested nationwide. [size=no report]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 26 June, in Goma, in front of the MONUSCO base, several national staff member of MONUSCO have protested against downsizing of the mission and reduction of posts. [size=several]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 7 November 2020, local Christian groups together with local authorities, civil society organizations and the MONUSCO marched in Rusthuru town (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu) against the rise of intercommunal violence and tribalism. The march was a response to recent deadly clashes between Nandes and Hutus and its associated militias. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: On 1 December 2021, tens of people gathered in Shari (Irumu, Ituri) to block (through unknown means) a vehicle of the MONUSCO from passing through. The MONUSCO fired shots in the air to disperse the group. Subsequent reports suggest the group was protesting against the MONUSCO after one of its vehicles hit and killed a motorcycle taxi driver (assumed accidental). The FARDC eventually came to restore order at the scene. [size=tens]

ACTOR2: ECOMOG: Economic Community of West African States Monitoring Group (Liberia)
NOTES: ecomog calmed down riots by shooting shots into the air and killed 2 people, one ex-Ulimo J fighter

ACTOR2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
NOTES: Bushs demands to Taylor to step down resulted in protests in capital city.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CDC: Congress for Democratic Change
ACTOR2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
NOTES: supporters of defeated presidential candidate George Weah of the Congress for Democratic Change (CDC).

ACTOR2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
NOTES: ex-soldiers striking over pensions are met by resistance from UNMIL

ACTOR2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
NOTES: ex-soldiers demanding payrise

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Liberia (2003-2006)
NOTES: UNMIL soldiers staged protest demanding pay and benefits

ACTOR2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
NOTES: soldiers at EBK barracks at Roberts International Airfield rioted about government pay

ACTOR2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
NOTES: National UNMIL staff protested over poor working conditions. According to the New Zealand Herald, UNMIL peacekeepers manhandled protesters.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020); Military Forces of Chad (1990-2021)
NOTES: 38 to 100 Chadian MINUSMA soldiers abandoned their base in protest of late payments and demanding better working conditions. They returned after two days when MINUSMA agreed to improve camp conditions.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: Some weeks ago, several chadian soldiers attached to MINUSMA burned their blue berets protesting the delay in salary payment.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNGF staged a demonstration outside Jazeera training camp, close vicinity to Jazeera Gate at noon of 09/06 to express their anger over the non-payment of salaries for the last six months. AMISOM troops deployed to bring the situation under control and to disperse the demonstrator. Some gun-shot were heard but so far no casualties are reported.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Tensions rose between the resident community and the newly announced administration of Jubaland in Garbarhaarey on 15/06. ENDF troops dispersed demonstrators gathering in a public place in Garbahaaarey and no casualties were reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF occupied the regional administration offices in Garbahaarey on 08/11 following prolonged dispute between the current administration and the former.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ACTOR2: Protesters (Somalia)
NOTES: An AMISOM soldier guarding Galmudug State House shot and killed one of the electoral delegates in front of the election venue in Cadaado on the morning 16/11. The slain delegate, who was protesting against the process of the election, reportedly barred other delegates from the entering the election venue and this provoked the AMISOM soldier to shoot him. The perpetrator was arrested.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Students (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An AMISOM Caspir hit and damaged a civilian vehicle that was exiting a nearby garage at Afisyoni road in Waberi district. Students and angry civilian bystanders blocked the AMISOM convoy. Police forces intervened and the incident was discussed with the AMISOM commanders. There were no reports of human casualties.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: IDPs protested against the closure of a market within the UN base in Malakal. UN Peacekeepers used tear gas. 5 injured. No reports of serious injuries.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Anti-war demonstrations inside UNMISS protection site in Juba.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: 7,000 IDPs in UNMISS camp in Juba protest, calling for Kiir to sign the IGAD peace agreement.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Private Security Forces (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On October 16th, security guards employed by Warrior Security (recently acquired by Insight) protested in Juba, over unpaid benefits, a desire for increased wages, and the terms of the new contracts soon to be introduced as a result of the takeover. The guards locked the gates to the UNMISS compound in Juba.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unamid has announce in a press statement that on Monday, hundreds of people converged on the Al Zubair Stadium in El Fasher, North Darfur, to participate in the launch of the 'We Need Peace Now' campaign, organized by Unamid and the National Sudanese Youth Union to support the peace process in Darfur.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Protesters (Sudan)
NOTES: Protests at UNAMID base in Kass, protesting against clashes between UNAMID and Zaghawa militia occurring earlier in the day. Foreign Ministry claims UNAMID fired on the protesters, killing one.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Protesters (Sudan)
NOTES: A second day of protests at UNAMID base in Kass. Foreign Ministry claims UNAMID fired on protesters, killing a second protester.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: UNAMID employees protest over non-payment of dues.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former local UNAMID staff protested in front of the mission's premises in El-Fasher for alleged non-payment of financial dues since 2010. Similar protests were held in 2016.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former local UNAMID staff protested in front of the mission's headquarters in El-Faher for alleged non-payment of financial dues since 2010. Similar protests were held early 2017 and in 2016.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: More than 50 former UNAMID staff launched a three-day sit-in strike in El Fasher to demand financial rights for dismissed workers. On the second day, NISS dispersed the protesters, taking them to their office.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: More than 50 former UNAMID staff launched a three-day sit-in strike in El Fasher to demand financial rights for dismissed workers. On the second day, NISS dispersed the protesters, taking them to their office.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-); Labour Group (Sudan)
NOTES: On 8 October 2021, dozens of former employees of the UNAMID mission gathered at the organization's headquarters in El Fasher (Al Fasher locality, North Darfur state), demanding that pension contributions, end-of-service pay, and insurance monies owed. [size=dozens]
